intro: Restio conspicuus, commonly known as the showy restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to fire-prone environments. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Restio conspicuus is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
